author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 10-year-old boy died after he came under the wheels of a sand-laden bullock cart on Thursday.

Police said the boy was travelling on the heap of sand being transported in the cart, when he slipped and fell down.

Irfan, a resident of Hajipura in Karugambathur, was studying in a primary school in Hajipura.

He was in the practice of travelling in the bullock cart belonging to Silambarasan, who was residing in the neighbourhood.

He might have accompanied him to take sand from the Palar riverbed, police said.

Close to 7 a.m. on Thursday, he was travelling on a heap of sand loaded on the bullock cart.

Illegally mined sand

The sand was illegally mined from Palar riverbed. When the cart was coming near Perumal Nagar, he slipped and fell down from the cart, and came under its wheels. He succumbed to head injuries, police said.

Virinchipuram police have booked Silambarasan on various charges including of causing death by negligence.

Silambarasan went into hiding after the accident.
title: Boy killed by sand-laden bullock cart
